definition: dish (food prepared according to a specific recipe)
dish (type of food)/vegetable/cuisine/CL:盤|盘[pan2],道[dao4]/(coll.) (one's) type/(of one's skills etc) weak/poor

sentences.english: Maybe I'll finally learn to knit. Or cook something with more than three ingredients.
sentences.chinese: 也许我最终会学会编织，煮有三种以上配料的菜式。

sentences.english: The French are seldom interested in unusual combinations or surprise presentations.
sentences.chinese: 法国人对不常见的配搭或是奇怪的菜式鲜有兴趣。

sentences.english: Some national cuisines make you fat.
sentences.chinese: 有些国家的菜式也会令你发胖。

sentences.english: One of the best known region dishes in this area is river snails.
sentences.chinese: 当地最有名的菜式之一是田螺。

sentences.english: Escargots is one of the most welcomed dishes in our buffet.
sentences.chinese: 局蜗牛是我们自助餐最受欢迎的菜式之一。

sentences.english: A banquet should contain dry and sticky dishes as well as crisp and juicy ones.
sentences.chinese: 桌子上既有干，粘，也有爽脆，汁多的菜式。

sentences.english: The food can almost tell the hardship Hakka people had to endure while they left their homeland.
sentences.chinese: 从这些菜式就可以想象客家人离乡别井时所受的艰辛。

sentences.english: Dishes are buffet, Western-based, per capita consumption of 280 yuan.
sentences.chinese: 菜式是自助餐，西式为主，人均消费280元左右。

sentences.english: So what exactly will be on the menu?
sentences.chinese: 那么菜单上到底都有些什么菜式呢？

sentences.english: And more success on the farm meant a greater diversity of dishes on the table.
sentences.chinese: 田里成功率高了，人家餐桌上也就菜式多了。

sentences.english: Make some stable dishes that you can eat and buy some protein powder.
sentences.chinese: 做一些自己的固定菜式还有买一些蛋白质粉。

sentences.english: Pre-ordered cuisines will be served on time, by professional servants.
sentences.chinese: 提前预定菜式标准定时就餐，由专业服务员上岗。

sentences.english: We like the bent toward Asian and Spanish flavours that's there throughout the book.
sentences.chinese: 我们很喜欢整本书里倾向于亚洲和西班牙菜式的风格。

sentences.english: He always sets a generous table for guests.
sentences.chinese: 他招待客人吃饭时，菜式总是十分丰富。

definition: dish/lean and hungry look (resulting from vegetarian diet)/emaciated look (from malnutrition)
signature dish/a restaurant’s most famous dish
dish (type of food)/vegetable/cuisine/CL:盤|盘[pan2],道[dao4]/(coll.) (one's) type/(of one's skills etc) weak/poor
to arrange food on a plate/to plate up/food presentation/(watchmaking) balance wheel
